title: Pseudo-element
description: The Pseudo-element in CSS is a type of selector used to style specified parts of an element, such as `::before` or `::after`.
content: The selector used to style parts of an element without adding extra HTML. Common pseudo-elements include `::before` and `::after`, which allow inserting content before or after an element's content. They help in adding decorative elements or text without modifying the HTML structure.
